column5: With all this cold weather coming and the season coming to a close on the 15th, there are going to alot of huts that will be frozen into the ice if they aren't lifted and blocked. The temperature doesn't look like it is going to rise enough until the closing to allow the huts to thaw out. Hopefully you can get out there to do that or it is going to be very tough getting those huts out later.   Rob C
I suppose it is more fun to drag them out there, than it is to bring them back in. Sorts like all the x-mas decorations that are still up on peoples houses, and we are now in March.
Remember to chip your blocks out and take them with you when you remove as well.  Weather is showing +4's for weekend and they are saying maybe even +10 for next week.
Cold? Nah,  its only going to be -25 or so on Tuesday up here in the wind.
Good point Wayne  Spring time boating is always interesting . Have hauled out 6' lengths of 4 x 4 's , skids etc.  TB
Do the MNR boys do a check of the lake for huts not removed.??

I would hope so .Huts are reqistered (numbered) for that purpose. But There is a hut that has been washed up the south end of Cooks bay for several years now.  By the way ...Welcome Aboard Thirstystone!  TB
Thanks  Tinbanger.  I"m new here to this board and enjoy reading and learning from the posts.  I hope to do some posting soon. I usually start fishing in the spring.
